task_instruction:
Rot-23 is a cipher in which each letter is shifted 23 positions forward in the alphabet. For example, here is a message written in rot-23:
Rot-23 text: "Pqxv"

To decode this message, we shift each letter 23 positions backward:
1. P -> S
2. q -> t
3. x -> a
4. v -> y

Therefore, the original text is: "Stay"

Here is another message in rot-23. Decode this message one letter at a time. On the last line, write the words "Original text:" followed by the decoded message:
Rot-23 text: "%s"

Rot-23 text: "Pqxv"

To decode this message, we shift each letter 23 positions backward:
1. P -> S
2. q -> t
3. x -> a
4. v -> y

Therefore, the original text is: "Stay"

Here is another message in rot-23. Decode this message one letter at a time. On the last line, write the words "Original text:" followed by the decoded message:
Rot-23 text: "%s"
